Question
========
Which of the following are units of energy? *Select all that apply.*

Answerlist
----------
* $\mathsf{kg\,m^2\,s^{-2}}$
* $\mathsf{N\,m}$
* $\mathsf{J}$
* $\mathsf{kg\,m^2\,s^2}$
* $\mathsf{kg\,m\,s^{-2}}$
* $\mathsf{kg\,m\,s}$
* $\mathsf{m^3\,kg^{-1}\,s^{-2}}$


Solution
========
The SI unit of energy is the joule (J). One joule is also equal to
$$1 \mathsf{\,J} = 1 \mathsf{\,N\,m} = 1 \mathsf{\,kg\,m^2\,s^{-2}}$$
